TitleSelect: Thanksgiving Traditions: "20 Bộ câu hỏi & Trả lời | Exploring Thanksgiving Traditions"
ListenList: What do you know about Thanksgiving?
Maria says Thanksgiving is a holiday to give thanks for the harvest.
John believes it commemorates a feast shared by Pilgrims and Native Americans.
Anna thinks it is a time to express gratitude for blessings.
Do you celebrate Thanksgiving in your country? If so, how?
Maria celebrates with a big family dinner.
John’s country does not celebrate Thanksgiving.
Anna’s family has adopted the tradition and celebrates with friends.
What foods are associated with Thanksgiving?
Maria lists turkey, stuffing, and pumpkin pie.
John mentions cranberry sauce and mashed potatoes.
Anna adds sweet potatoes and green bean casserole.
What is your favorite Thanksgiving food?
Maria loves the turkey.
John’s favorite is pumpkin pie.
Anna enjoys the stuffing the most.
Who cooks Thanksgiving dinner in your home?
Maria’s mother usually cooks the dinner.
John helps his wife with the cooking.
Anna and her siblings share the cooking duties.
How do you cook the turkey?
Maria says they roast the turkey in the oven.
John prefers to deep-fry the turkey.
Anna stuffs the turkey and bakes it.
What time do you start eating?
Maria’s family starts eating around 2 PM.
John’s family eats at 5 PM.
Anna’s family has dinner at 6 PM.
Why do you think people celebrate Thanksgiving Day?
Maria thinks it's to give thanks for the good things in life.
John believes it is to remember the Pilgrims' first successful harvest.
Anna feels it's a time to gather with loved ones and be grateful.
What time of day does your family typically sit down to eat Thanksgiving dinner?
Maria’s family sits down to eat in the afternoon.
John’s family eats in the evening.
Anna’s family prefers to eat in the late afternoon.
What are some Thanksgiving traditions?
Maria mentions watching the Thanksgiving Day Parade.
John talks about watching football games.
Anna highlights the tradition of sharing what everyone is thankful for.
What are some Thanksgiving traditions in your family?
Maria’s family goes around the table and shares what they are thankful for.
John’s family watches a movie together after dinner.
Anna’s family takes a walk after the meal.
Do you think Thanksgiving is a family holiday? Why?
Maria believes it is because it brings family together.
John thinks it’s a family holiday due to the emphasis on togetherness and gratitude.
Anna agrees, adding that it’s a time for family bonding.
What does "Thanksgiving" mean to you?
Maria says it means being thankful for what she has.
John feels it means celebrating with loved ones.
Anna thinks it represents gratitude and sharing.
What day is Thanksgiving celebrated in the United States? Canada? Your Country?
Maria says it is celebrated on the fourth Thursday of November in the US.
John knows it is the second Monday in October in Canada.
Anna mentions that her country does not have an official Thanksgiving holiday.
What is your favorite Thanksgiving memory?
Maria’s favorite memory is her first time cooking the turkey.
John’s favorite is his first Thanksgiving with his wife.
Anna’s favorite is the family trip to the mountains during Thanksgiving.
What is your worst Thanksgiving memory?
Maria recalls a time when the turkey was burnt.
John’s worst memory is missing Thanksgiving due to a work trip.
Anna’s worst memory is when a family argument spoiled the holiday.
Why is football often associated with American Thanksgiving?
Maria thinks it’s because of the tradition of Thanksgiving Day football games.
John believes it is a way to entertain and bring people together.
Anna thinks it’s because football is a popular American sport and a national pastime.
If you had to list your favorite holidays, what number would Thanksgiving be? Why?
Maria says Thanksgiving is her second favorite holiday after Christmas.
John ranks it third after Christmas and New Year’s.
Anna places it as her favorite due to the family focus and food.
What did you do on Thanksgiving this year? What did you do last year?
Maria had a small family dinner this year and a big gathering last year.
John had a quiet dinner at home this year and traveled to see family last year.
Anna celebrated with friends this year and with family last year.
What are some of the things you are thankful for?
Maria is thankful for her family and good health.
John is thankful for his job and friends.
Anna is thankful for her supportive family and career opportunities.

seo.Title: Exploring Thanksgiving Traditions
seo.metaTitle: Thanksgiving Traditions: "20 Bộ câu hỏi & Trả lời | Exploring Thanksgiving Traditions"
seo.metaDescription: Discover the cultural significance and traditions of Thanksgiving celebrations.

contentArray.content: Thanksgiving is a time-honored tradition in many cultures, especially in the United States and Canada, where families gather to give thanks for their blessings and enjoy a festive meal together.
The traditional Thanksgiving dinner usually includes roast turkey, stuffing, mashed potatoes, cranberry sauce, and pumpkin pie.
My favorite Thanksgiving food is definitely pumpkin pie!
In my family, Thanksgiving dinner is typically cooked by my grandmother, who has her special recipes for turkey and stuffing.
Thanksgiving dinner usually starts around early evening, allowing everyone to gather and share a meal together.
Thanksgiving is celebrated to express gratitude for the harvest and blessings of the past year.
